definition: to hint/to indicate (an idea to sb)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Dr. Halsey held up a hand , indicating that he halt.
sentences.chinese: 哈爾茜博士舉起一隻手，示意他停一下。

sentences.english: He smiled and touched the ground with his hand, meaning that I should sit down.
sentences.chinese: 他微笑着並用手輕觸着地面，示意我坐下。

sentences.english: She inclin-ed her head andstared straight ahead.
sentences.chinese: 她示意着，歪過腦袋直直地看着前方。

sentences.english: I noticed him winking at his brother.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到他他兄弟眨眼示意。

sentences.english: The skinny man said he was more polite because he always tipped his hat to ladies.
sentences.chinese: 瘦子說他更有禮貌，因爲他經常對女士摘帽示意。

sentences.english: Ricks motioned to them, and five of the guys trotted over.
sentences.chinese: 裏克斯向他們示意，五個男生一路小跑過來。

sentences.english: Handshakes should mirror the other person’s handshake with good eye contact.
sentences.chinese: 握手時，應保持很好的眼神交流，以示意對方握手。

sentences.english: Figure 6 shows the typical clamping of a video signal by a video decoder.
sentences.chinese: 圖6爲視頻解碼器箝位視頻信號的典型示意圖。

sentences.english: With his head stuck on the ground, the poor man acknowledged her kindness and beckoned the woman to go away.
sentences.chinese: 乞丐善解人意地趴在地上擺了擺手，示意女人離開。

sentences.english: Mr. Hillme, her social-studies teacher and accompanist, winked at her.
sentences.chinese: 希爾米先生是她的社會課老師兼伴奏，向她眨眼示意。

sentences.english: Figure 72 shows schematically one possible situation .
sentences.chinese: 圖72示意地表明一種可能的情況。

sentences.english: Yes, but don't touch the bar unless I signal you.
sentences.chinese: 是的，但是除非我向你示意，否則別觸摸鐵槓。

sentences.english: Fig. 4 The driver with three coordinate.
sentences.chinese: 圖4三座標驅動裝置示意圖。

sentences.english: He beckoned us over and introduced us to his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他示意我們過去，然後把我們介紹給他的妻子。

sentences.english: Henry motioned with his hand for Stephen to come closer.
sentences.chinese: 亨利動了動手，示意斯蒂芬靠近一些。

sentences.english: She crooked her finger to beckon him.

definition: to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent

combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书[liu4 shu1] of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds/to comprehend without being told explicitly/to cotton on/knowing (smile, glance etc)
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to turn one's head/to turn around
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
